comments:
On suse, 9.3 (gtk) when adding entries to a table and a scrollbar is drawn, an
endless org.eclipse.swt loop/stack overflow occurs.
Only happens when the display resolution is a certain size and before any
scrollbar is drawn.  If the dialog/table is resized prior, the error does not
occur.  After the first time the error happens, it does not occur again (the
scrollbars are drawn).   If the placement of table 
entries is different from the default (being some text lines followed by a text
line with a progressbar), the error does not occur.
When the error occurs, the vertical scrollbar is apparently in the process of
drawing (its area is created (grey) but the up/down buttons are not drawn yet,
the progress bar table item also appears to be drawn in the scrollbar region for
a brief moment).

Clicking no when prompted to shutdown eclipse because of the stack overflow
appears to have no ill/unstable effects on the operation of eclipse.

The problem does not appear to manifest on motif or windows. 

Stack trace follows:

!SESSION 2005-11-07 21:33:28.558 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.version=1.4.2_08
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86
...

!MESSAGE java.lang.StackOverflowError
!STACK 0
